qas.question: Who was the governor during World War II?

context: After the Civil War began, Governor <a0_0><b5_0>Zebulon Baird Vance<b5_0/><a0_0/> ordered the construction of <a1_0><b9_0>breastworks<b9_0/><a1_0/> around the city as protection from Union troops. During General Sherman's Carolinas Campaign, Raleigh was captured by <a2_0>Union cavalry<a2_0/> under the command of General <a3_0><b7_0>Hugh Judson Kilpatrick<b7_0/><a3_0/> on <b8_0>April 13, 1865<b8_0/>. As the Confederate cavalry retreated west, the Union soldiers followed, leading to the nearby Battle of Morrisville. The city was spared significant destruction during the War, but due to the economic problems of the post-war period and Reconstruction, with <a4_0>a <b6_0>state economy based on agriculture<b6_0/>,<a4_0/> it grew little over the next several decades.
